body:
Here is a reference:
https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar_precommit_java8/3924/testReport/org.apache.pulsar.client.api/DeadLetterTopicTest/testDeadLetterTopicWithMultiTopic/
```
org.testng.internal.thread.ThreadTimeoutException: Method org.apache.pulsar.client.api.DeadLetterTopicTest.testDeadLetterTopicWithMultiTopic() didn't finish within the time-out 120000
	at org.apache.pulsar.client.api.PulsarClientException.<init>(PulsarClientException.java:35)
```

this should be resolved in the next realease
not able to figure out the root cause for #2647 . so disabling this test case to bring CI to normal first.
@david-streamlio , Please fix the ut and header issues, Thanks.

@jerrypeng can you take a look at this stack trace?

Solved:
a jar is not included in classpath because of bad naming:
`org.apache.pulsar-pulsar-functions-runtime-all-2.1.1-incubating.j`
instead of
``org.apache.pulsar-pulsar-functions-runtime-all-2.1.1-incubating.jar``

running locally:
```
- before produce hello.
➜  apache-pulsar-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT git:(func_state_rest) curl -s http://localhost:8080/admin/v2/functions/test/test-namespace/word_count/state/hello
key 'hello' doesn't exist.%                                                                                                                                                         ➜  apache-pulsar-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT git:(func_state_rest) bin/pulsar-client produce -m "hello" -n 10 test_wordcount_src

- produce hello once
➜  apache-pulsar-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT git:(func_state_rest) curl -s http://localhost:8080/admin/v2/functions/test/test-namespace/word_count/state/hello
value : 10, version : 9% 

- produce another time
➜  apache-pulsar-2.2.0-SNAPSHOT git:(func_state_rest) curl -s http://localhost:8080/admin/v2/functions/test/test-namespace/word_count/state/hello
value : 20, version : 19%      
```
@sijie there's legit failures here that i need to deal with before it'll pass. There's also a lot of flake happening on other tests. We should block all submissions until these are dealt with.

I think we should also try to think of a more general approach for this problem. 

Right now, the only per-topic policy override is for the authorization settings. While is good to add backlog retention override, in future we might need to add more for each policy tunable. 

For sake of setting a format in the policies metadata, we could have a map with all the per-topic overrides that can support all the available policies.

Then we can kind of reuse the same code for setting specific policies on the namespace, to apply also for the single topic case.
All the primitive schemas are already available in latest master. so close this issue.
I think this is fixed by #2640

### Following configurations can overwrite in topic level:

- [ ] 1. MessageTTL [Get, Set]
- [ ] 2. Retention Policy [Get, Set]
- [ ] 3. Message Dispatch Rate [Get, Set]
- [ ] 4. Backlog Quota [Get, Set, Remove, Clear Backlog]
- [ ] 5. Persistence Policy [Get, Set]
- [ ] 6. Max Producer [Get, Set]
- [ ] 7. Max Consumer [Get, Set]
- [ ] 8. Compaction Threshold [Get, Set]
- [ ] 9. Offload Threshold [Get, Set]
- [ ] 10. Deduplication [Set]
- [ ] 11. Offload Deletion Lag [Get, Set]

Should we need a issue to tracker them.
It’s not only for podlings. Created a new one for TLP. #2665
@codelipenghui yes. let's create an issue as a master issue for tracking the support of topic-level policies.

run cpp tests
run java8 tests

The reason this happens if because in Pulsar different modules depend on different version of the same dependencies.  While I think there is a way to fix it, I am not sure how much benefit it will actually bring.  @MarkAddison is this a critical issue for you?

rerun java8 tests
rerun cpp tests

👍

Matteo Merli <notifications@github.com> 于2018年9月28日周五 下午1:09写道：

> Motivation
>
> I have seen few issues with ee5afa5
> <https://github.com/apache/pulsar/commit/ee5afa5007e260891140956d244a865d73368321>
> :
>
>    1.
>
>    There are 3 new methods in the PulsarClient interface which are meant
>    to be used together. We should reduce
>    the public API to the minimum possible. So I propose to just have a
>    Pulsar.updateServiceUrl() which internally
>    will perform all the needed operations in order to reconnect the
>    client to new endpoint.
>    2.
>
>    We shouldn't be exposing ClientConfigurationData in the API since it
>    belongs to impl package
>    3.
>
>    There is a leak of resources when the LookupService gets replaced with
>    the new one since the existing
>    is not closed.
>
> Modifications
>
> Refactored to simplify API for adding ServiceUrlProvider
>
> cc/ @codelipenghui <https://github.com/codelipenghui>
>
> It would be good to get this into 2.2 since it's changing the API for this
> new feature.
> ------------------------------
> You can view, comment on, or merge this pull request online at:
>
>   https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/2671
> Commit Summary
>
>    - Simplify ServiceUrlProvider related APIs
>
> File Changes
>
